sen.j: 天橋立鋼索鉄道（あまのはしだてこうさくてつどう）は、京都府宮津市の府中駅から傘松駅に至る丹後海陸交通のケーブルカー路線。
sen.e: The Amanohashidate Cable Railway is a cable car line operated by the Tango Kairiku Kotsu Co.,Ltd. that connects Fuchu Station (located in Miyazu City, Kyoto Prefecture) and Kasamatsu Station.
The Amanohashidate Cable Railway is a cable car line operated by the Tango Kairiku Kotsu Co.,Ltd. that connects Fuchu Station (in Miyazu City, Kyoto Prefecture) and Kasamatsu Station.
The Amanohashidate Cable Railway is a cable car line operated by the Tango Kairiku Kotsu Co., Ltd. that connects Fuchu Station (in Miyazu City, Kyoto Prefecture) and Kasamatsu Station.

sen.j: 天橋立ケーブルカー、傘松ケーブルとも呼ばれている。
sen.e: It is also called Amanohashidate Cable Car or Kasamatsu Cable.
It is also called Amanohashidate Cable Car or Kasamatsu Cable.
It is also called Amanohashidate Cable Car or Kasamatsu Cable.

sen.j: 北近畿タンゴ鉄道北近畿タンゴ鉄道宮津線の天橋立駅から日本三景の天橋立を経て成相山成相寺へ至る参詣ルートの途中にある。
sen.e: The line is located on the pilgrim path to Nariaisan Nariai-ji Temple from Amanohashidate Station on the Miyazu Line of the Kitakinki Tango Railway via Amanohashidate, one of the three most famous scenic places in Japan.

The line is located on the pilgrim path from Amanohashidate Station on the Miyazu Line of the Kitakinki Tango Railway to Nariaisan Nariai-ji Temple and passes through Amanohashidate, one of the three most famous scenic places in Japan.

The line is located on the pilgrim path from Amanohashidate Station on the Miyazu Line of the Kitakinki Tango Railway to Nariaisan Nariai-ji Temple and passes through Amanohashidate, one of the three most famous scenic places in Japan.

sen.j: 索道が併設してあり乗車券は共通となっている。
sen.e: A cableway runs in parallel to the cable railway, both of which are available with a common ticket.
A chairlift runs parallel to the cable railway, both of which can be used with a single ticket.
sen.cmt: "cableway"→"chairlift" ― I thought "cableway" and "cable railway" was a bit confusing and pictures of the "索道" actually show a chairlift
sen.e: A chairlift runs parallel to the cable railway, both of which can be used with a single ticket.

sen.j: 15分間隔の運行で所要時間は4分。
sen.e: Cable cars run every 15 minutes and the travel time is 4 minutes.
Cable cars run every 15 minutes and the trip takes 4 minutes.
Cable cars run every 15 minutes and the trip takes 4 minutes.

sen.j: 時期により営業時間が変わる。
sen.e: Operating hours vary depending on the season.
Operating hours vary depending on the season.
Operating hours vary depending on the season.
April, May, June, September, October, July 1-19, and August 21-31: 8:00 - 17:30
April, May, June, September, October, July 1-19, and August 21-31: 8:00 - 17:30
April, May, June, September, October, July 1 - 19, and August 21 - 31: 8:00 - 17:30
sen.cmt: ハイフンの前後にスペース挿入

sen.j: 1927年（昭和2年）8月13日 成相電気鉄道が府中～傘松間を開業。
sen.e: The Seiso Electric Railway opened the line between Fuchu Station and Kasamatsu Station on August 13, 1927.
August 13, 1927 - Line between Fuchu Station and Kasamatsu Station opened by Seiso Electric Railway.
sen.cmt: Changed word order and made more 'note' style as in Japanese original by deleteing articles, auxilliaries, etc
sen.e: August 13, 1927: Line between Fuchu Station and Kasamatsu Station opened by Seiso Electric Railway.

sen.j: 1927年（昭和2年）12月22日 天橋立鋼索鉄道に社名変更。
sen.e: The Seiso Electric Railway changed its company name to Amanohashidate Cable Railway on December 22, 1927.
December 22, 1927 - Seiso Electric Railway renamed Amanohashidate Cable Railway.
sen.cmt: Changed word order and made more 'note' style as in Japanese original by deleteing articles, auxilliaries, etc"changed its company name to"→"renamed"
sen.e: December 22, 1927: Seiso Electric Railway renamed Amanohashidate Cable Railway.

sen.j: 1944年（昭和19年）2月11日 不要不急線として廃止。
sen.e: On February 11, 1944 the line was discontinued as being unnecessary during the war.
sen.cmt: 「不要不急線」について、「戦争中」との説明を追加しました。
sen.e: February 11, 1944 - line discontinued as unnecessary during the war.
sen.cmt: Changed word order and made more 'note' style as in Japanese original by deleteing articles, auxilliaries, etc
sen.e: February 11, 1944: Line discontinued as unnecessary during the war.

sen.j: 1951年（昭和26年）8月12日 丹後海陸交通により府中～傘松間が再開業。
sen.e: The line was reopened by the Tango Kairiku Kotsu Co.,Ltd. between Fuchu Station and Kasamatsu Station on August 12, 1951.
August 12, 1951 - Line reopened by Tango Kairiku Kotsu Co.,Ltd. between Fuchu Station and Kasamatsu Station.
sen.cmt: Changed word order and made more 'note' style as in Japanese original by deleteing articles, auxilliaries, etc
sen.e: August 12, 1951: Line reopened by Tango Kairiku Kotsu Co., Ltd. between Fuchu Station and Kasamatsu Station.

sen.j: 府中駅は勾配が78&amppermilと、粘着式鉄道である箱根登山鉄道箱根登山鉄道鉄道線の最急勾配区間（80&amppermil）よりも緩斜面で、そのためホームは階段状ではなくスロープとなっている。
sen.e: Since the grade at Fuchu Station is 78‰, which is gentle compared to the maximum grade (80‰) in the section of the rail line of Hakone Tozan Railway (adhesion railway), the platform of Fuchu Station adopts a slope, not stairs.
Since the grade at Fuchu Station is 78‰, which is gentle compared to the steepest section (80‰) of the adhesion traction Hakone Tozan Railway, the platform is sloped, not stepped.
sen.cmt: "maximum grade (80‰) in the section of the rail line"→"steepest section (80‰)""(adhesion railway)"→"adhesion traction" and moved
sen.e: Since the grade at Fuchu Station is 78‰, which is gentle compared to the steepest section (80‰) of the adhesion traction Hakone Tozan Railway, the platform is sloped, not stepped.

sen.j: 府中駅：北近畿タンゴ鉄道北近畿タンゴ鉄道宮津線の天橋立駅から丹後海陸交通バスまたは同社観光船利用。
sen.e: Fuchu Station can be reached by a bus or a sightseeing boat operated by the Tango Kairiku Kotsu Co.,Ltd. from Amanohashidate Station on the Miyazu Line of the Kitakinki Tango Railway.
Fuchu Station can be reached by bus or sightseeing boat, operated by the Tango Kairiku Kotsu Co.,Ltd., from Amanohashidate Station on the Miyazu Line of the Kitakinki Tango Railway.
Fuchu Station can be reached by bus or sightseeing boat, operated by the Tango Kairiku Kotsu Co., Ltd., from Amanohashidate Station on the Miyazu Line of the Kitakinki Tango Railway.

sen.j: もしくは天橋立を徒歩。
sen.e: Or by passing Amanohashidate on foot.
It can also be reached on foot via Amanohashidate.
It can also be reached on foot via Amanohashidate.
